definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: Plural marriage was abolished after the foundation of PRC.
sentences.chinese: 新神州建立後廢除了一夫多妻制。
你們可能對一夫多妻制無所謂。

sentences.english: Texans are not used to polygamists in their neighbourhood.
sentences.chinese: 德克薩斯人並不習慣於鄰里之間的一夫多妻制。

sentences.english: The pattern of copulation behavior mainly exists in the form of polygyny.
sentences.chinese: 在扭角羚羣體內主要是以“一夫多妻制”的形式存在。

sentences.english: The threats of prosecution and persecution have usually been enough to keep polygamists subdued. But lately they are becoming emboldened.
sentences.chinese: 濫交和強迫性行爲只是一夫多妻制最顯見的危害所在。

sentences.english: Those who were the first wives of polygamists scored similarly.
sentences.chinese: 一夫多妻制中的大老婆情況類似。
舉一個一夫多妻制的主題。

sentences.english: As a rule concubinage was more the custom than multiple wives.
sentences.chinese: 而納妾與一夫多妻制相比更符合中國的傳統風俗。

sentences.english: What distinguishes Islam from other major religions is that it tolerates polygyny .
sentences.chinese: 伊斯蘭和其它主要宗教不同的是它容忍一夫多妻制度。

sentences.english: Although South African law recognizes traditional polygamous marriages, simultaneous weddings are rare.
sentences.chinese: 雖然當地法律認同一夫多妻制，但這種婚禮仍屬罕見。

sentences.english: Polygamy still exists in some forms among upper class members of some minorities.
sentences.chinese: 一夫多妻制現在仍然存在於一些少數的上層階級中。

definition: to regard men as superior to women (idiom)
forced marriage/arranged marriage (without the consent of the individuals)
